meanings.definition: The act of enveloping or enclosing something.
meanings.sent1: The envelopment of the gift made it look beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The cat enjoyed the envelopment of warmth from the blanket.
meanings.sent3: The envelopment of the sandwich by the cling wrap was a bit excessive.
meanings.sent4: The envelopment of fog around the mountain created a mystical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The envelopment of darkness in the cave was eerie and unsettling.

meanings.definition: The state of being enveloped or enclosed.
meanings.sent1: The cozy envelopment of the blanket helped her fall asleep.
meanings.sent2: The envelopment of the room in silence was calming.
meanings.sent3: The envelopment of the cat in a box was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The envelopment of the city in snow transformed it into a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The envelopment of the forest in mist gave it a mysterious aura.

meanings.definition: The process of wrapping or covering something completely.
meanings.sent1: The careful envelopment of the fragile vase protected it during shipping.
meanings.sent2: The envelopment of the cake in frosting made it look irresistible.
meanings.sent3: The envelopment of the puppy in a towel after a bath was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The envelopment of the building in vines gave it a charming appearance.
meanings.sent5: The envelopment of the book in a dust jacket preserved its condition.
